Otherwise, service was friendly and decent if you are forgiving that things took longer to come (or not at all) since they're so busy (food, water, extra utensils....). They also kept running out of supplies (kids drink cups, soup to go containers)... better stock up! 

The seating were great since there were booth and table seating. I had really wanted a highchair but gave it up for a booster seat when I found out that I was going to be put back on the waiting list. 

Their strawberry lemonade was tasty and I asked them to keep it coming. Haha. I ended up with the Mahi Mahi tacos (came with 2) and the side of chips and I was content. I just wished it didn't take forever for us to have the meal.

Service was friendly and nice. However, they got my order wrong when I asked for a plain sandwich. 

The bigger issue was the ants all over the drink area. That was a little disturbing. Also their water button doesn't work And that was all I was able to drink. 

A little disappointed.

Friendly staffed and always packed whether it is at the counter or the drive-thru. So far the orders have been correct which is more I can say for some other locations. 

It is connected to the gas station so you can walk right over if you need something. The ventilation isn't that great in there but if you can get in and out quick. There are great combinations and the usual list of Dunkin Donut favorites.

LOVE it here! It's clean, bright and happy feeling, waterfalls, outdoor music, plants, trees, and did I mention clean? What more can I ask for? 

It is set up like an outlet (the outdoors concept) but it a lot more pleasant feeling. You can walk around and enjoy yourself. Tired from shopping? Take a seat on the wooden benches or the rocking chairs. 

They have high scale stores like Williams-Sonoma, teen stores like Hollister and Aeropostale, department stores such as Macys and JC Penny, and a few special boutiques. Barnes & Noble is one of the favorites.

There are many delicious looking restaurants with beautiful decors scattered around the mall. There is even a late nite "club" that I have yet to visit. They do have food shops such as Moe's Southwest Grill, Cosi, a Teriyaki shop, and a Crepe shop. 

Looking for an evening or holiday event? They got it. Just look out for the large banners when you pass by and make sure you pay attention to the details (time and date) since I show up at the wrong times/dates sometimes.

I've always liked Ker's Winghouse and this time it was no different. They opened in place of the Buffalo Wings that was suppose to open many moons ago and it's a great place. 

Service is fantastic and attentive. The managers were great and friendly. Everyone was there for anything that you may need.  

I always order my wings mild and naked and still love it. I like how their wings are mild and I get to add the amount of hot sauce that I would like especially if I am eating with people who do not like spices. Happy hour is great but beat the crowd! 

Parking is a problem now but I hear that they will have expanded parking soon.

I like this location and its usually tidy and clean which is why I enjoy coming here. 

The cashiers are usually friendly especially the guy with the great animated voice. 

They have everything you would probably need at these stores. everything for different holidays and greeting cards! Kitchenware, toiletries, food!

I don't come to this location much since it's not in my neighborhood but it's one of the ones that play some independent films that other do not.  

I came here with some girlfriends the other night and enjoyed our time here.  Loving my large tub of popcorn and soda. A girl gotta splurge some time! The theaters were decently cleaned and the bathrooms weren't terrible even though it was the end of the night already. I was glad.

I've come here for the dim sum or some of the Cantonese dishes. The service is decent. 

However, some of the dim sum dishes aren't the way I remember it from NY or even close. There's been a few instances where I was sorely disappointed with the dishes. One time the sticky rice that just seemed undercooked. I was afraid to even have it. Sadly, I had given it more than a few tries and haven't been back since.

Great corner coffee shop. Friendly staff and nice seating area. I Wasn't up for the bar seating this time but maybe next time! It's all shared seating though so you're pretty close to the people around you.

They had some shirts and coffee for sale on the side but nothing like ordering a nice cappuccino for the morning and sipping it while being engulfed in the scent of coffee.

No wifi here though!

They are located in the GROVE mall towards the back. You can hit this and TJ Maxx back to back.

This old navy is usually a stocked. The service is friendly but the lines are usually long! The clearance section is always great but there is not much items there.

i love the south. i love southern food. i love delicious pancakes.  i love amazing  country ham. i love sweet tea. i love having a big booth all to myself.  i love nice waitresses. i love people who stand up to greet someone they run into at a restaurant during breakfast. i love waitresses that offer to give me a refill of sweet tea for the road.  l love breakfasts that cost $8.

i hate leaving pancake pantry.

Visiting Tampa for the second time, our colleagues here decided to take us out to Boizao.  I've never been to one of these Brazilian Steakhouses, but have heard a lot about them.  I knew that I was in for a lot of food.

Food - The amount of meat that you eat here is ridiculous.  14 different types of meat is offered to you throughout the evening.  There is a cardboard circle in front of your seat that is red on one side and green on the other.  If you place the green side up, they will offer you a piece of meat....if you have the red side up, they will pass your table.  I had the green side up most of the evening. I think I sampled everything except one or two types of meat.  Here's what I tasted:

Filet Mignon
Filet Wrapped in Bacon
Lamb Chops
Leg of Lamb
Pork Tenderloin
Ribs
Prime Rib
Picanha
Picanha com alho (with Garlic)
Top Sirloin
Bottom Sirloin
Brazilian Pork Sausages
Chicken Legs marinated with beer

Yep....I pig'd out!  I passed on the salad bar though....as I knew I would have to save room in my stomach for all of this food.  I even had a little room for a Tiramisu for dessert.

Service - I thought the service was excellent.  There were 7 of us and we never had an empty glass of wine, water, or food.  The servers were very attentive and cordial.

Atmosphere - The dining room is large and dark.  Nice setting for a dinner.  The tables are spaced appropriately....what I mean is that they aren't too close together.

Parking - There is valet parking that's available.

Special Offers - I hear that kids under 7 eat FREE.  That's what my colleague who lives in Tampa tells me.  He says they come here once a month with his 5 kids.  That's a great deal.

Will I return?  Only when I'm in the mood for massive amounts of meat....which is not too often.  That's not because I don't like the restaurant, it's because I don't eat meat that much.

This place is a dump.  It's basically a gutted warehouse that looks like it was built in the 1960's and hasn't been updated since.  We came here for a gun show, which had very few vendors.  The parking is small and the entry to the expo center is weird....it's on the right side near the back of the building.

If I was a meeting planner, I wouldn't hold any meetings here unless it was for a swapmeet.

Return Factor - 1%

Ok, so I found this place using Yelp.  I was in town on business and my hotel was only a couple of miles away.  After reading the excellent reviews, I decided to give it a try by myself.  Here are my thoughts.....

Service - Everyone was friendly and knowledgeable.  I was greeted by the host and seated immediately.  My waitress was on top of things and the food came out on time an fresh.

Food - I had the Tomato & Feta Bruschetta w/Baked Tortilla for an appetizer....it was awesome!  I highly recommend it.  The bread was fresh and delicious.  For an entree, I had the cheeseburger....I would have tried something else, but I really wanted to try the bruschetta appetizer and I didn't think I could eat that and an entree by myself.  The burger was excellent....just the right size, not too large and not too small.  The fries were steak-cut fries and cooked perfectly....not too hard/soft.

Atmosphere - I was here in the Spring time and the weather was awesome....so I ate outside on the patio.  I'm glad I did....it was very relaxing.

Wine - The wine selection was decent....not great, but decent.  I had a glass of the Malbec....don't remember what the vineyard was though.

While I was dining....there were no more than 5 tables occupied in the joint.  I heard that lunch and brunch are much busier.  So, I guess if you want to enjoy the place and have a nice, relaxing time.....go at dinner.

Will I return?  If I'm in the area.....For Sure!

Stayed two nights here.  Rooms are very nice, but the bathroom is a little small.  They're modern and clean, which is very important to me.

They have a very good selection of restaurants.  We dined at the Buffet, Steakhouse & Mexican joint during our stay.  Reviews on those are here:

PY Steakhouse
http://www.yelp.com/biz/py-steakhouse-tucson#hrid:8KJbPpTCgqNlNOgIBiLAWw

Tequila Factory
http://www.yelp.com/biz/tequila-factory-tucson#hrid:32_J-W-4rNrDap9JNFCmog

Festa Buffet
http://www.yelp.com/biz/festa-buffet-tucson#hrid:bGixUWahY--pO_K9AC42-w

The staff is very friendly.  They greeted you at every guest touchpoint and asked if you needed assistance.

Overall, this was a very cool place for a short weekend getaway.

TIP - Be careful of the speed traps on the road to/from this place.  There are photo/radar speed traps that will nail you if you are not careful.  Signs warning you about it are small and difficult to read...easy to overlook.  A friend got a ticket during our trip

Return Factor - 88%

This bar was located in the lobby of the hotel I was staying at.  The place is decorated with sports memorabilia and the banners of the local teams. 

Food - The food here is ok.  I tried the Angus Sliders, which were good and the nachos, which were bleh.  The menu is an extensive bar menu with all of the typical bar menu items.

Drinks - It is a full bar, so they can make all types of drinks.  The one thing that surprised me was that they didn't have Shock Top....which is a wheat beer.  You can find Shock Top all over Tampa, but not here for some reason.  Instead, they have Blue Moon....which is very good, but I enjoy Shock Top when I'm in Tampa.

Service - The waitresses and bartenders here are very friendly.  However, at times they can forget about you and leave you with an empty glass for a while.  One good thing is that there are tons of TVs in the bar, so if there is a game you want to watch that's not on one of the TVs, they will put it on one for you.

Will I return?  If I'm staying in the area.....yes.

Amazing find on Yelp....my business partner and I were in Tampa for a business meeting and decided to get some Italian Food....found The Laughing Cat and were glad we decided to take the trip to Ybor City.

Food - I had a Caprese Salad for an appetizer while my friend had the Mussels with Marinara sauce.  The portions were huge.  

For entrees, I had the Lasagna while he had the Veal Parmigiana....again, both huge portions.  The Veal was really big....there was no way we were going to finish.

The food was excellent.  The only thing that I would have liked done differently is that I like my pasta al dente.  The Lasagna was a little overcooked in my opinion.....great flavor though.

Service - The service was awesome.....can't complain.

Atmosphere - The place is a hole in the wall.....not upscale by any means, but the food is worth it.

Will I return?  If I'm back in the area....you bet!

Don't want to be in the Quarter?
Don't want to listen to drunks and clowns all night long?
Great location - walkable to the Quarter and Convention Center, and the trolley.
Good rooms, but bad beds. I don't even know what to think about the beds except they felt like prison beds with an extra coverlet. Major Fail!
But, Staff was amazing - every single one! The bellmen, the front desk ladies, especially the server who came out and made us bloody mary's before the bar opened. I am telling everyone I know about this location, because not only am I a loyal Saints fan and a loyal Hilton member, I love this location. Boom!
They have a breakfast buffet, free wireless, and fridges and microwaves in the rooms. A decent workout room and pool.
This is a good spot for grownups.

Let's start with slowest free wifi ever.
But, as I sit in my room, which over looks the ocean and the best sunset I've seen in a  very long time, and I listen to covers of Bob Marley being sung from across the water, there is nothing better right now.
This is a cool spot. The location is righteous. Average restaurant attached, but great happy hour, and good snacks. Very reasonably priced.
The rooms are dated. but clean. Old school and prob perfect for a family vacation. Each balcony which overlooks the water is superb. The view is money. 
If you face the parking lot...so sad, too bad. 
Even the shittiest hotel is most awesome with a waterfront balcony, reggae music, and a glass of vino.
Done!

My bff recommended this place and I was so excited to get my NoLa eat ON.
Alligator cheesecake. Watermelon mojitos. The lamb sirloin entree with greens and mashed potatoes on the side. Honestly, one of the best damn meals I have ever had.
Great service. Charming environment. Off the beaten path location, uptown on Oak St. Took the trolley back down to the Quarter easily.
Not only a recommend, but a Must-Go!

Fantastic service!
You can choose between bistro (bar) seating or the fine dining area. You can still get the fine dining menu in the bistro area but there are plenty of choices on both menus.
The lamb lollypops were delicious - the pesto was a nice touch.
The crab cakes had a spicy kick. Great for a little snappy appy with a glass of wine.
Te chicken mushroom Caesar  salad had great flavors and was plenty for one or two to share. Good wine list and   plenty of options for steak or small plates.
Good variety. Good westport option.

Quick service and good food.
We ordered toasted ravioli (Oh I miss you St Louis!), and then each had the soup/ salad combo. Great prices for good food. 
A few soups to choose from, we had clam chowder and chicken tortilla soup, which was prepared with actual tortilla chips (not strips), but had a cheesy bottom and was really good. We chose caesar salads over the house salad, and it was a good size - great lunch portions.
Pleasant staff. Great location - a quick walk to the arch grounds - right on Laclede's Landing.

Day trip. Average girls...almost too young to look at.

I got carded and I know I'm old enough to mother the bartenders. The theme is the same as the rest of the chain.
They did have a super cute collection of hard hats which I wanted to take home. 
Other than that, it's a pit stop on the road to live music.

It leaves a lot to be desired, but the food is good. Cooked right in front of you on one of those grills I don't think ever gets really cleaned, that's probably why the food is so "tasty".

They have something on the menu called "scrapple". Described on the menu as sausage & hash browns dipped in pancake batter, fried & covered in gravy.
I had a ham and tomato omelet, with a side of hash browns. You can pick items ala carte to add to your 2 egg/ cheese omelet. Very good.
Very small, limited seating, but a family atmosphere. The bar seating was a tad too close to the griddle for me, but again, a family feel.
It almost reminded me of a truck stop without the showers and convenience store registers.

Major props to these guys. I had to rent a snowboard for my 10 yr old.
We were charged for an adult setup & then the sweet cashier couldn't figure out how to credit back the difference to my credit card. They asked us to resolve it when we were done skiing & brought the equipment back.
When we got back there was a bit of confusion about why we were requesting the refund, but all in all what they gave us was a free rental for next time, so all is good.
The service is always good. Everyone who is fitting renters seems to know what they are doing and I appreciate the quality of knowledge about the area and skiing/ riding in general.
Plus, the equipment is great. I couldn't buy such awesome gear for my kids (nor would I) so it's nice to get to ride something amazing every once in a  while.

Well, the decor was cool. I love rich decor. I love russians. I love vodka.

BUT, this bar and the people in it were a little stuck on themselves.
It's like the hot girl at the party that won't talk to anyone because she thinks she's too hot. 

Maybe Pravda is too hot for the quarter, but I beg to differ.

They do serve drinks though, so I won't go on.

This is a standard classy joint.
The bartenders are cool, professional gentlemen.
Mr B's caters to a sophisticated business clientele, but still has the New Orleans flavor.
I was lucky enough to be sitting at the bar next to a self proclaimed, "conservative bastard". Awesome! Welcome to New Orleans.

The seafood gumbo is delicious(bowl licking good). I didn't, but I thought about it. Solid cocktails - an enjoyable experience whether there for business or pleasure.

This is our favorite place in Tucson. I love that it's a scratch kitchen and that the menu changes all the time! The cooks and owner are so friendly and personable. The food is always tasteful and fresh. They are so baby-friendly and always provide a little side of food for our 9 month old, which I think is so sweet of them. We feel comfortable eating here as a family rather than some other places who aren't so baby-friendly. We are vegetarians and like that they are conscious of gluten-free and vegan platters. They also offer cheese and eggs if you'd like. We highly recommend this place, but want to keep it as a hidden local gem for ourselves because it's getting very popular!

Friendly, excellent, reasonable prices, very clean! I usually use my own tools but I didn't with them because I trusted how well they clean their equipment. It's a family owned and operated business, which means better customer service. Walked in without an appointment and waited less than 2 minutes to be seen. Parking is free and open. Jimmy worked on me and he is very detailed and thorough from cleaning to polish. Highly recommend. So happy they're only up the block from me!

Their gelato is really good and they carry an abundant amount of flavors. They do offer non-dairy items in the sherbet section. Two things that would improve their business: they need a punch card system to encourage customers to come back and their prices are a little high, compared to...no other gelato shops in Tucson -_- Makes sense. For two smalls, can equal up to $9. My fave is always Pistachio and Coconut.
Oh, Ragin' Daisy had the perfect leopard print coat that actually FIT!  I wish I would have bought it, but I knew it wouldn't fit in my suitcase for the trip back home.  Regret!!!

Friendly local hang out, quiet.  I came here because it was close to my hotel.  They have a big TV if you are into that.  I enjoyed the eclectic music playing when I was there, vintage Madonna then Joy Division.  

Bartenders are really nice and the food was a pleasant surprise.  I had a great burger and fries one time, the mac and cheese special with a salad another time, and the tomato basil soup the last time.  All were really well cooked and flavorful.  It kind of became my go-to for a tasty, casual meal.

This is probably one of the more authentic eateries that we've come across in the area.  They've got a large selection of items available but its done tapas style.  Ordering can quickly lead to an order of 6 items for 2 people and a bill of $30. But hey, its actually pretty worth it.  The tortillas are handmade, the cheese is authentic and isn't the typical orange and white cheese blend you're used to.  It amazed me that a kitchen so small was able to pump out food in such qty and volume. 
One of the things that made this place an experience was the menu.  If you're not good at deciding, try to get a glance at the menu or a picture of it while you're in line.  Usually, you don't see it until you're on deck for ordering @ the register and trying to make up your mind with 2 or 3 items that seem familiar can throw you.

I've passed this place many many times and normally wrote it off because it was often not busy inside and it is at the tail end of the Albertson's parking lot where nothing is open. 
One day, while my gf and I were shopping, we stopped and looked at the menu and it was actually quite promising.  The prices were above average for what we would normally pay but we gave it a shot anyway.  
We ordered asada super nachos and an al pastor burrito. The food came quickly and i barely had time to raid the salsa bar b4 our togo order was ready. 
When we got home, we found that the burrito was massive and would have fed us and our dog alone.  The nachos were just as large and we were both equally impressed with the overall quality of the food that we had gotten. 
For a $10 plate of nachos and 8.95 for a burrito, the price was a tad high but it was worth it.  Since we're local, we'll definitely be back for another sampling of the menu.

Let me just start by saying that I recently moved to the area from LA and my review may be a bit biased because of the caliber of Thai food that I am normally used to.  I should also note that I frequent some of the better Thai establishments around LA county so my review is probably bias.

Meun Fan Thai simply fell on "ok" status for me. My girlfriend and I went here to have lunch one weekend and we were really disappointed by the limited menu offerings and the quality of the food after we had ordered. Sure this place is nice and clean, but just because you have a gold elephant on the wall, it doesn't make your restaurant legit Thai.
One of the first things that I noticed about the menu was the lack of noodle soups. Sure there are hot pot and tom yum but where's the boat noodle? That should be a simple thing to have on the menu and is usually a staple item on just about any Thai menu.
My girlfriend ordered the Pad Thai and while the color and flavor were present, the noodles were a shame. They were more pho noodle than typical rice stick noodle that pad thai usually is made with. This made it more soggy and not as good to eat.
My order of curry noodle had a brick of noodles sitting in curry sauce.  It was sad. How does one overcook a brick of pre-prepped noodles?

Anyway, needless to say, 10$ per dish was not pleasing. Sure we pay higher prices due to location and area but dishes of this quality and caliber would not have been any more than 7.50 on any other menu.
Big fan, always come whenever I am in the area. High quality, good portions, very reasonable price. Friendly staff. Super lunch specials.
very solid! very friendly and great lunch specials! come here all the time when i am visiting my folks. americanized chinese, no complaints!

I'm only snobby about 2 types of food living in LA, Korean and sushi. I take my sushi seriously in CA. For a sushi restaurant in willow grove, I'll admit I wasn't expecting a ton. But I was pleasantly surprised. This place is very solid, I would say comparable to any mid tier LA place but a lot more reasonable priced. Sushi deluxe for $21 including 9 nigiri, a California roll, salad and miso soup is solid. Also tried Gyoza and udon, both on point as well. Plus service is very attentive and pleasant. Nice decor as well. Will definitely come back when I am visiting the folks. Even better, no corkage fee!

It's so cute whenever I hear someone pronounce praline (pra-leen). I bought half a pound, thinking I was going to hand it out to friends and family in Houston but I ended up eating the whole thing in one day. It's that good, if you have a sweet tooth! When I'm pms-ing, it's all I dream about. Definitely coming back and buying in bulk...
Sunday tasting menu is terrific. Leave it to the chef to feed you good stuff
Terrific burgers, if a little overpriced. Try the various pickles too, especially beets and tomatoes.

Very tasty vegetarian options. Good prices. Friendly staff. I had the vegetable timbale and it was amazing. Husband had grilled vegetable wrap and he said it was delish but not as filling as he would like. The toppings bar is great with lots of sauces and extras. Highly recommended for a quick lunch bite.
Best sushi place by far! This place far surpasses any sushi place back in California. Great service, fish is always fresh, and the rolls are amazing. My favorites are the 11am and the Donald Duck.
Went for brunch last week and had the crabcake omelette which was DELICIOUS! This is one of my favorite places to get takeout.

I love this place!!!!!!!  I've been here twice and had the tilapia tacos. The first time I went, I thought the taco was out of this world! The second time.... not so much.  It tasted bland, and like not much effort (or seasoning) was put into it.  So, my opinion is that they can really cook here, but they have off-days depending on how crowded it is.  I enjoyed that first taco so much that I'm willing to keep going there.  

The pastries are sooo good! Both times I had a perfect apricot tart.  This will be a place I go to often.

Uh oh,Blue2o, I'm worried about you. This will make the SECOND bad meal I've had there. Tsk, tsk tsk!!!  We went there on Saturday for dinner, and I ordered the pretzel-crusted tilapia. It was absolutely terrible. The crust was hard and tasteless. The fish was tender and cooked well underneath all that crust, so I just kind of ate around it.
My meal was like $30, and that's an awful lot to pay and not love your meal.

I also came to the realization that I HATE the Blue 2o salad. It has cranberries and walnuts in it, and I'm not a fan of either, yet, somehow every time I eat here, I forget that and end up with this nasty salad.

Went for lunch. I ordered Fish with Black Bean Sauce and my fiance' had the Cumin Chicken. Mine was good, just verrrrry salty and he didn't enjoy his food at all. He said his chicken was too hard and tasted old...not fresh.  Although the food was good, it doesn't quite have the same feel as other Chinese restaurants that give free fried wontons and fortune cookies. It seems more mainstream and commercial. That's a shame, because those are the unique touches that people enjoy at Chinese restaurants.

Visited the University City Sabrina's-- finally!!! Actually, this was my 2nd time there, but we ended up leaving the first time because the wait time was outrageous. Anyway, we just left Sabrina's s after having a fabulous dinner.  This is why Sabrina's is the best Philly has to offer. It doesn't matter what time you go or which location you choose to go to, the food is consistently GOOD!!!!

I ordered the Pan Seared Salmon and my fiance', my favorite dining companion, had the Greek Tilapia.  Both were fantastic, and I expected nothing less.  We liked this location because it was basically empty, and we were able to enjoy a quiet and relaxing dinner.  Our waitress was very nice, and they usually are at all of the Sabrina's locations.

I HAD to update this review because the past year with Freedom has been a nightmare.  My accounts have been tampered with countless times in the past year. Not sure by whom, but according to Freedom, they have detected numerous attempts to hack my accounts and steal my money.  Once they even called me and told me some guy was at Walmart in Woodbury, New Jersey trying to charge things on my credit card WHILE MY CREDIT CARD WAS STILL IN MY WALLET.  How does this happen? 

Needless to say, this was a major inconvenience for me, because EACH time, Freedom treated ME like the criminal by freezing my accounts. I have lost count of how many times I have been at the checkout counter trying to buy things, only to find out my ATM card has been declined.  This is especially unnnerving when I know I've got plenty of money in my account. Once, my card was declined when I was at Dunkin Donuts trying to buy a donut. A DONUT.

The other thing I can't stand about this bank is how long it takes for checks to clear.  The money is not available when they say it will be and they couldn't care less.  I could go on and on, but I have to call their accounting department YET AGAIN to beg for them to release some of my own money to me.

I'm kind of surprised at the bad reviews. Ok, I've only gone to the Farmer's Market on slow days, maybe that's it. If I can't find a parking spot, I don't stop in. I refuse to put money in a meter. So....every time I've gone, the place has been empty, and I'm like, their only customer.  Their muffins are fantastic. Personally, this is my favorite place to go for a huge muffin full of big pieces of real fruit.  I love their muffins. They also have very good ricotta cheesecake. Yes, they're on the expensive side, but you get what you pay for. If you want a cheap, overly-sweet muffin, go to Dunkin Donuts. I truly wish this bakery was on my route to work.

OMG..... are they sure it's safe to shop here? The outlets are ok, but I had a hard time geting past the ominous nuclear towers in front of it. Very scary.... but people were shopping, eating, and drinking around it like everything's cool.  I liked the Ann Taylor and Loft outlets, Calvin Klein and my bf liked the Puma, Zumie's and Pac-Sun outlets. I expected to love the Banana Republic outlet, but it was just okay.

I don't see me going there very often. Those towers are just too close for comfort!

I still love this place, but I do have a gripe. I ate here on Thursday, and got to the lunch buffet at about 2:30. They had run out of bandh gobi (curry cabbage), which is actually my favorite vegetable there. I waited and waited, but they never replenished it.  I was NOT happy about that because I don't feel like I got my money's worth. A buffet should continue to replace empty trays until the buffet is over or charge less.

Stopped in about 2 weeks ago on a Friday. Had the chicken and waffles. Absolutely NOT a winner.  Please go back to the drawing board. One other thing... the hostess was very unfriendly and did not greet us at all. I actually had to say hello to HER and force her to speak.  When she did, it was very reluctantly. We almost left, but because we were pressed for time, we stayed. She set the tone for what would be a terrible lunch that day.

OMG.... we ate  here this morning for brunch, and it was absolutely AWFUL. I ordered the Salmon Scramble. It was beyond bland, and the fruit that accompanied the entree was old. They use no-name, dollar-store teabags, and the pancakes were disgusting. Their pancakes were the yellow kind (cake batter, maybe?) and they were GROSS. I have had horrible stomach cramps since leaving this place. I'm hoping I don't have food poisoning. Had to stay home from work the next day to recuperate.
This is the place I go to fix my many pairs of tattered shoes and broken heels. It's convenient, but they get a 2 because the Russian woman who owns the place has a bad attitude and a smart mouth.
Went again on Saturday and had the redfish. Not good. It was dry and boring.  Never again! I will stick to the tilapia.

Two people can eat at this buffet for $21.95....that's a HUGE difference compared to the $40 my fiance' and I normally spend when we eat at Indian restaurants.The food is VERY good! I pile my plate high with chicken tikka masala, chicken tandoori, chicken vindaloo, biryani, bhindi masala, basmati rice and naan. Delicious! I have also ordered Tandoori shrimp from their a la carte menu, but the buffet is definitely the way to go.

This is a horrible McDonald's. I have NEVER had to send my frenchfries back TWICE because they taste bad until I came to THIS place.  After the second disgusting round, I came to the conclusion that this McDonald's just makes bad fries. They were hot, but HARD.  They tasted like they were OLD right after they came out of the fryer.  Well, I probably didn't need those fries anyway.  LOL

I know this is a mall spot, but I still like my privacy!! I don't like how they massage you out in the open at this place! Each customer should have their own private area. It makes it hard for me to go into relaxation mode when I can still see and hear conversations of passers-by.

The minute we stepped inside of Kitchenbar, my fiance' remarked that it felt like a souped up diner.  At first. I didn't realize what he meant until I observed the wait staff was wearing UNIFORMS!!  None of the waitresses wear uniforms in any our favorite restaurants.  Second, our waitress had a lackluster attitude. She couldn't be more nonchalant. She barely spoke to us as she took our order and delivered our meals.  Third, the music they were playing was HORRIBLE! It seemed out of a place for a restaurant that, judging by the decor, was trying very hard to be hip!  

However, when our FOOD came, there was no mistaking that this was absolutely NOT a diner. We both ordered the Encrusted Tilapia, which was (as described on their website), broiled tilapia encrusted with a blend of portobello mushrooms, sundried tomatoes, crispy potatoes and basil, drizzled with a scampi wine sauce, served with grilled vegetables.  It was soooooo good!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I had been craving a good fish entree, and Kitchenbar delivered.  At 16.99 for our entrees, we thought Kitchenbar was reasonably priced.

For dessert, we had the Banana Caramel Xango, which was absolutely one of the best things I've put in my mouth...ever!!!! Without a doubt, we will return to Kitchen Bar.... there are so many other things on that menu I need to try!

Sooooooo... everyone who loves Indian food knows it's really expensive. I try to get lunch specials whenever possible.  That being said, I went to Saffron for lunch today.I really love their food. It's one of my favorite restaurants in the area. Anyway, when we got there, my fiance asked the guy at the door if we could still get the lunch special. He said YES.  Cool! 

 We sat down and prepared to order. I noticed they only gave us a dinner menu, so I asked our waiter for a lunch menu He told me lunch was over. I looked at the time, and it was clearly 2:30.  So I asked him,"What time is lunch over?"  He answered,"2:30."  Unbeknownst to this guy, I eat here pretty regularly and I KNEW that was a lie.  I decided to look on their website and see what their lunch hours were, just in case they changed their hours or something. My fiance and I agreed that if this guy had lied to us, we would LEAVE and go to Tiffin. 

OF COURSE, the website clearly said lunch was over at 3. We walked right out of the restaurant and decided to take our money elsewhere.   What a disappointment!! Saffron has DELICIOUS salmon and chicken tikka masala, but you know what? So does Tiffin.

Ate here again on Friday, and as usual, my food was excellent!!!  I'm adding an extra star now because our waiter was kind enough to move our table outside so my bf and I could eat outside. Unfortunately, it started to rain, but I appreciated the effort!  

People who came here expecting glitz and glamour know very little about authentic Jamaican spots. Forget about the fact that it was in a movie.....if you want some fantasy dining experience, go eat at a Beaches resort or something or go eat at Bahama Breeze.

My food came within 15 minutes and the service was wonderful. Yah Mon....

My bf and I just ordered takeout from Honey's. The person who took our order was extremely RUDE and SHORT with us. Granted, it was close to their closing time, but not THAT close where anyone should have had an attitude about it. If that's the case, tell us you're closed!!!!   

Honey's is getting beside themselves now because of their so-called popularity. They need to remember that it was the CUSTOMERS who made it so. (Especially YELPERS.)

We didn't appreciate the sarcastic and "smart-alecky" tone the cashier took with us.

I love this place, especially their crab wontons, lettuce wraps, Ginger Salmon and Mongolian Chicken, Beef, or Shrimp. I love the atmosphere too. Even though it's a chain, it's one of my favorite places to eat.

Found this place because I was starving during my late class in grad. school.  Not good..... not good at all. Mind you, I ordered SHRIMP FRIED RICE! How do you screw that up? Well, they found a way.  My rice was rock-hard and flavorless and there were about 5 shrimp in my pint.   I have never tasted BAD shrimp fried rice, most places know how to make AT LEAST that.... except Chinese Delight.

Had lunch here the other day.  Not bad, but I've had better. The Makhani Chicken was a little on the tough side.  Loved the Chana Masala, Saag Paneer, and the salad was crisp and fresh. The naan was ok, but they didn't have mango OR tamarind chutney. This was a major disappointment for me. Nevertheless, the Ghulab Jamun, Kheer and Chai tea were all okay.

We ate at Jones again today, and I have to say,"No, No, NO, Jones!!!!!!!!!!  You do NOT serve Chicken and Waffles with a bland CHICKEN GRAVY!!!" IT does NOTHING to bring out the flavor of the chicken OR waffles. Terrible gravy. Luckily, the chicken didn't need it, and we ate the waffles with syrup.

While we're on the subject of waffles, what was up with the HALF of Belgian waffle you guys served us?  I have never been given a HALF of waffle at a restaurant before. Surely you guys can splurge a little and give us a WHOLE waffle.

I was looking for a breakfast spot w/ good pancakes because IHOP  on City Avenue doesn't always take phone orders. Trio is going to be the place.Wow.... what a menu!  Chicken and waffles! Fish and grits!Salmon cakes! Crab cakes! Chipped Beef! Monte Cristo sandwiches! Omelettes! And for lunch, things like Salmon Terikyaki, cheesesteaks, tuna melts, bufffalo wings hoagies and quesadillas.

My pancakes were hot, fresh and GOOD and my scrambled eggs needed no seasoning whatsoever and were cooked perfectly!!

I only wish the place was open later than 3, because I could see myself going here a lot!!! Also, they are closed on Sundays, which is when I usually get my pancake cravings. :(

This is one of my favorite breakfast places, and definitely my favorite place to get banana pancakes. Those things are massive, and they come with a delicious buttery syrup/ sauce that tastes so much better than regular syrup. This place also has the best fresh squeezed Valencia orange juice.  My fiance and I were going here every weekend for a while, but took a break after the hostesses started to recognize us.  I highly recommend Grand Luxe, with no hesitation.

I must be a glutton for punishment. I gave Larry's another chance and it actually became my "go to" place when I want a chicken cheesesteak...... until today.   Larry's gave me a serious case of food poisoning a few years back that left me sick and on a specialized diet for about a month.  Fast forward to today. I had a chicken cheesesteak for lunch, and I can feel the makings of another illness coming on.  Something is definitely not right abut this place.

My bf and I ate here last Sunday. I ordered eggs, homefries and toast. My food was DELICIOUS!!!!  I know my meal was a plain meal, but their cook added a little flair to it. My potatos were so flavorful, my eggs were cooked just right.  My food was outstanding!!!

We went to Honey's at 3:00 this time, so there was no crowd, and I was able to enjoy my food more than the first time.

This review is strictly for the delivery service.I used to teach in this area, and I ordered from this place weekly.  Sometimes I would have my students go down and pick up my orders for me when I was unable to leave the classroom.  Well, one of those times, I had my students pick up the order, I was supposed to get $10 back in change. I sent a note down with my students saying that his tip was $4.00 The delivery guy took it upon himself to pocket ALL of my change.  Mind you, I tip... and I tip NICELY, but I d-mn sure was not tipping him $14.00.  This made me angry, to know that he really thought he deserved that much money for coming around the corner and dropping off a cold box of pizza.  

As for the food, it's ok.  The pizza is good, when it's HOT. TWICE I ordered from them for my class pizza parties and it was delivered to me ICE COLD. They also make good strombolis and chicken cheesesteaks.  Not a TERRIBLE choice, if you MUST order from here, just count your change if you get delivery.

I'm going to try to be as gentle as I can with this review.  I went to Total Serenity yesterday for a massage, and it was a horrific experience.  I'm trying to be gentle, because the woman who took care of me seemed to be somewhat nice. However, she has absolutely NO EXPERIENCE with professional massage. I get better backrubs from my 7 year old niece.

I would have to agree with one of the other people who posted before me who said that the masseuse had no technique, just straight up and down rubs.  At first, I thought this was just her way of prepping or warming up my muscles. I kept thinking to myself,"Okay, NOW the real massage will begin!!" LOL. Well, after saying that about 20-30 times, I knew this woman didn't know the first thing about a REAL massage. This made me mad, because my back and neck were full of stress knots.

Well, the worst was yet to come.  She moved on to my legs and started doing some crazy technique that made me want to yell out in pain!!!  I get massages fairly often at other places, so I'm pretty sure she was doing it WRONG. Every person who ever massaged my calves and thighs did it in a relaxing way to get the kinks out.

On top of that, I think this woman had a BUTT FETISH!!!  LOL. I'm laughing right now, but I wasn't laughing yesterday.  As she massaged my thighs, she made sure to end each stroke with a handful of my butt.Each time, she stroked it slow and sensually, almost like she thought it was turning me on!  EWWW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I don't want that kind of massage from a woman!!!  It was sooo unbelievably uncomfortable.  

I felt bad, because my bf gave me the massage as one of my birthday gifts, and instead of leaving the salon relaxed and refreshed, I felt even more tense and stressed from clenching my butt cheeks every time her hand grazed and caressed it. When it was over, I couldn't get to the exit FAST ENOUGH!! lol. To add insult to injury, she had the nerve to hand me an empty envelope, indicating that she was expecting to get a tip.  Well, I ended up tipping her a few dollars, because in the end, I usually DO tip people when I receive any kind of service. Trust me, I would have rather kept that money in my wallet. 

I understand that for some people, the butt massage is no big deal, but I would have preferred to be asked. Don't just grab it and HAVE AT IT without my permission. This experience has me so jaded, that I doubt I will ever go to a spa for a massage again. I'll stick to Massage Envy and places in the mall. They do a better job anyway and for much less money.

Oh, and forget about trying to get an appointment here. It took me two weeks to get mine, because no one answered the phone during business hours, and then when you leave a message, no one calls you back!

Do yourself a favor, don't go to Total Serenity for a massage. I can't speak on their other services, but massages are definitely not their forte'.

Not bad.  Not the BEST crabcake i've ever had, but certainly, very tasty.if I had never tasted a Maryland crab cake, maybe this place wouldn't have such big shoes to fill. I have to agree with the others, there is more filler than I'm accustomed to in my crabcakes.  I got a sandwich, and it came with chips and a pickle.  Not bad for $7.99.  

I will DEFINITELY return because this place will do in a pinch when I can't get to Baltimore. Thank you to my friend in Delaware for turning me on to this place.

This will be my final update on Larry's. Found out that the chicken cheesesteak I ate gave me E.Coli food poisoning!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  My fiance' was also sick.  I'm not sure if it was just a bad day for them or not, but I thought I should let everyone know. Larry's is obviously doing SOMETHING wrong! I will spare you the details on what I had to do to find out what was wrong with me from my doctor.  I have never been this sick before from something I ate.

The best thing I've had here is the Black Bean Chicken. It is DELICIOUS, and comes with all kinds of vegetables!  I usually just stick to broccoli, carrots, onions, peppers, and mushrooms.  They offer a lot of atypical chinese entrees.

Just had a horrible lunch here. Ordered the Salmon Bento box. The servers brought everything in the wrong order, totally screwing up my meal. First they brought my salmon and mashed potatoes. Then they brought my asparagus. Then they brought my salad. Then they brought my soup. The salmon and potatoes were cold. The asparagus was on a dirty plate with hard egg yolk on it. The soup came about 10 minutes into the meal and tasted horrible.  The salad was the best part. 

I left the restaurant hungry and dissatisfied. Ended up having Chick Fil A for lunch.

They're having a rough time.  My fiance and I stopped in to try it out and they took forever to give us our order, and when they did it was wrong. We were kind of in a hurry and thought we could stop in and get a quick dinner. WRONG.  For starters, there were about 12 people working that night, and no one knew what to do.  There were 3 people cutting a pita wrap for the person in front of us. WHY?  Two of them could have been starting orders from the quickly forming line in back of us.  At the second station, there were about 3 people putting the fixins inside of the pita. Again,  too many people at one station, confusing each other.  There were 3 more people at the last station, bagging orders and then the manager rang up the order.

Soooo... with all of these PEOPLE, why is it that when I got home, my chicken shawarma pita wasn't even in the bag??? So, we had to go allll the way back.  My fiance thought that maybe they just forgot it to put it in the bag, and it would be at the counter, but noooo, they actually stuck it in someone else's bag! We had to wait AGAIN for the sandwich to be made all over again.  Did I mention we were in a hurry? 

Overall, the food was ok. The sauces were pretty spicy, but that was a good thing. Double check your order before you leave, though.

My bf and I used to always go to Christiana when we were in college.  Back then, it was a run-of-the-mill mall with outdated clothes/stores. We mostly went there for the food court.

 Well, fast forward to 2011!! This mall has TOTALLY changed!!!  Wow! This mall can now compete with Cherry Hill Mall!! Out of nowhere, this mall became more upscale, and has stores I would actually shop in!!!

What a refreshing change from crowded King of Prussia, which is the mall closest to me.  I imagine that Christiana Mall gets pretty crowded on weekends, though. (After all, what else is there to DO in Delaware but go to the mall?) LOL.

This place is really starting to grow on me. Ever since I discovered how good their pancakes are, my fiance' and I have been stopping in here every couple of weeks or so. Their pancakes are perfect every time, and I have never had them brought to me cold. (Yet!) I'm super-picky about my pancakes, so that means a lot to me.

I also love that they have real maple syrup. Definitely a plus for me!
My favorite spot in the food court!!!! I usually get either the Bourbon Chicken or the Blackened Fish, plantains, noodles and or/ cabbage. Cheap and filling....

Just left Honey Grow and stopped at the condiment counter to get forks and sauces, and noticed one of their employees was on my heels.  At first I thought she was trying to get past me so I stepped aside.  When it became apparent she wasn't, I continued getting my sauces and forks. That's when it hit me. The drink machine is over here. She's trying to make sure I'm not taking a free drink.  Well... IDIOT, I didn't even have a CUP, so there was no need to stand so close to me that I could feel your breath on my back.

Managers of Honey Grow... you have GOT to come up with a better form of security than this. If you are that protective over your soda machine, put it behind the counter. This was intrusive, insulting and annoying. I just spent $40 in your restaurant, but will never spend another penny there. Keep your soda.

I'm NOT, by any means, a jogger. However, I'm WORKING on it!  lol  I'm a champion speed-walker, and for now, that's good enough for me! lol  That being said, I have to tell you about one of my favorite walking spots!

There is nothing like a nice morning walk at Valley Green. My bf and I love to start our weekends off that way, the earlier the better. Not to sound corny, but it's so quiet and peaceful out there, just you and nature. There's something soothing about the sound of the cool, running stream and fresh morning air. It's therapeutic, almost.

We usually find a good brunch spot after our walk. What a great way to spend a Saturday morning.

I was hoping to make Larry's my alternative cheesesteak place when I can't get to Allegro's, but that's just NOT GONNA HAPPEN.  Just ate there a few minutes ago, and my stomach is killing me!!!   Not sure why, really. My chicken cheesesteak wasn't TERRIBLE.... just kind of bland.  I had to keep putting salt and pepper on it for it to taste like anything, and even THAT didn't really help.

They also chop their mushrooms and onions so small that you can barely taste them. Their fries were pretty good, but kind of greasy. I;m guessing THIS might be where the stomach ache came from. 

I'll probably give Larry's another try at some point, but I won't be getting another cheesesteak from them again. It just wasn't good at all.


*********************************************************************

A day later, my stomach is still killing me!!!!!  I'm convinced this place puts ex-lax in their food. I will NEVER EVER EVER go back to this place. I can't remember ever having stomach pains this bad. AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE.

I love this place! Went today for takeout and got the "Boy Am I Hungry." (Yep... that's what it's called! LOL)  It consisted of eggs any style, french toast or waffle,bacon or sausage, (and yes, they have turkey!), and homefries or grits. Once again, my food was delicious!!!

Add to that how friendly the staff is, and Centennial is among my favorite brunch spots in Philly! I'm so glad most of you Yelpers haven't caught onto this place yet. One more plus about this place, they had their HEAT ON!!!!! Can't tell you how much I hate to be cold when I'm eating!!  It truly ruins a meal for me. 

Centennial is cozy.... the kind of place where you'll linger around after eating and have a second or third cup of coffee. (Or in my case, TEA!!)
Ok... I had to update again because it's now 4 days later, and I'm still sick!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  This is crazy... a serious case of food poisoning.

Thanks to all the Yelpers who recommended this place. Once again, you haven't let me down. The food is great here and so was the service!! I had the Chicken and Black Bean Sauce, bf had the Lamb with pesto, and a friend had the General Tso's Chicken. All of us enjoyed our food, so again... thanks.

Yes, I'm late!! But I finally got my Mac!! Every August for the past 3 years, I said I would get it, because I know that's when they have their back-to-school promotion. Well 2 years go, I got sidetracked by HP, and ended up buying a laptop from them and regretted it ever since!!  Finally, I resisted the temptation to keep an extra $700 in my pocket by buying a PC, and I went with my HEART. Yes, my HEART, because I have always loved Macs, but what can I say? I love clothes too, so.... well..... you know!! LOL

Our salesgirl was Eva, and she was new, but she knew her stuff.Best of all, she didn't come off as a "Know-it-all" or make me feel like an imbecile for some of my questions. Heidi was also very nice and helpful.

I got a free printer and a $100 gift card, so I'm a happy camper right about now. Best of all, I bought my Mac TAX-FREE.  The store was packed, but we were acknowledged the minute we stepped in the store, and I had my computer in my hand within 10 minutes, hassle-free. It made parting with close to $2000 almost painless. (I said ALMOST.) lol. Of course, I'm still basking in the afterglow of my new computer. This could all change when I need support. lol.

Had breakfast here for the first time in a long time. The pancakes are still very good and so are the potatos.  I do, however, see what people mean about the rude service.  While not directed at me personally, I detected a nonchalant attitude from one of the owners.  

A customer complained to her that there was not enough meat on her cheesesteak, and that she wanted her money back.  The owner told her she would only give her HALF of her money back, because she ate HALF of her sandwich. From my vantage point, I could clearly see the girl had only taken one bite out of it. Most places would just offer a total refund or make her something else to eat and apologize. i don't like the way that was handled at all.

What followed was an unnecessary argument that could have been avoided if the owner had just tried harder to accommodate the customer. It's little things like this that makes the difference between a dissatisfied customer and a returning one.

It is time to upgrade this theater. How does this theater expect to compete with theaters that have recliner seats and restaurants?  It's in a prime location, so I expect they will upgrade it soon.  Price-wise, they are every bit as expensive as a theater with more "frills."  I would suggest driving further down rt. 38 and going to Regal Moorestown instead.  

Seats, picture quality, and sound are horrible.  Bathrooms are filthy.  Be careful when ordering their snacks. Last time I ate here, I was served a hotdog that wasn't completely cooked and was sick for days.

Okay, Two DAYS later and I'm still feeling the effects of that cheesesteak. Why?? Did they cook my chicken cheesesteak on a dirty grill that had remnants of pork juice on it, maybe??  I am in bed BALLED UP right now.  

 Larry's..... I hate you!!!

This place has new owners and now serves "average" food.  I ate there today, and my $9.00 sandwich was AWFUL.  The bread was dry and old and so was the turkey. None of the ingredients in the sandwich were fresh. My coconut brownie was dried out and at least 2 weeks old, but they still over-charged me for it.

The place was empty!  After tasting that sandwich, I see why. It's NOTHING like it used to be. There were 2 people in the place, and they both either worked there or owned the place.  On top of that, the woman that worked there wasn't very friendly.  

I won't return to Centennial unless they get a total revamp. If they don't, I give them until December before the place is shut down.

Sampled their freezing cold buffet in July, 2017.  The place was empty, and my fiance' and I were the only customers. The food was good, but I don't think I should have to ask the waitress to microwave my plate of food for me.  That's a problem.  As I said before, the food has potential, but if it's not hot, who wants it?  Also... I love a clean floor as much as anyone else, but NOT while I'm eating. Someone decided mopping the floor with bleach while customers were eating was a good idea. For me... it was the final straw. We will not return.

I'm an A-list member, so I visit this location often.  For some reason, this location ALWAYS has problems on the first night of a movie premiere.  I have gone 4 times so far and sat for up to 2 hours to wait for them to get the movie together.  There's always an issue:  hard drive error, projection issue, movie wasn't uploaded, etc.  Sometimes they give credits, other times they just leave you sitting and wondering and offer nothing. When you go out and speak to a staff member, their "go to" line is,"The movie will be on in 5 minutes."  Last week, we went to a movie that was supposed to start at at about 9. The movie didn't start until 11:20. Ridiculous. At least offer free drinks to the people that stick around.

No, Becks.... Shrimp Po' Boys are definitely not your specialty. Not at all. Mine had entirely too much bread, my sauce was mediocre, and my shrimp kept falling awkwardly out of my roll.  I won't get this again here.

Now, the Shrimp Etouffee? THAT is definitely your thing! Yours is DELICIOUS!!!! I'm not sure why I didn't order that or the jambalaya in the first place. Actually, I do know. It was 95 degrees outside and I just didn't want anything that hot or heavy in my stomach. Luckily, my fiance' ordered it and was gracious enough to share his. Damn, it was GOOD, and I was immediately jealous because I knew he had the better entree.  Also enjoyed the cornbread- it complemented the etouffee nicely.  

Most importantly, the staff is exceptionally friendly. In fact, they were the reason we stopped there in the first place. They invited us to sample a few of their entrees and once we tasted them, it was a done deal.  I just wish I had ordered one of THOSE entrees instead of the Po' Boy.

I have made 2 complaints about this location,  and that's because the staff is awful. It honestly doesn't matter who takes your order because no one here has customer service skills. They don't greet you at all.  They're unfriendly.  They never tell you how much your order is. They make you look at the screen below the window yourself rather than extend a simple ounce of courtesy.  As I said, I've complained before, and someone contacted me by email, apologizing and claiming they will talk to and retrain their staff. I stopped in 3 days ago to see their new and improved customer service skills, and was treated just as poorly as before  by an older Indian woman. I smiled and said hello. She ignored me all 3 times, then rudely stuck her hand out of the window to take my money. This has got to be the worst location ever. These people clearly hate their jobs. I recommend everyone drive to the one at 5200 City Avenue, or better yet...go to Starbucks.  At least they made an effort to rebuild their image by demonstrating to their customers that they value their patronage.
Went again for lunch and got a waitress who INSISTED on placing us right smack next to another couple even though the place was empty!! I'm liking this place less and less......

Went here for dessert the other night with my fiancé'. We originally planned to have dinner here, but nothing on the menu sparked our interest, so we decided to get dinner from Bahama Breeze and dessert from Grand Luxe.  I like the atmosphere, and it definitely reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory. I assume they are owned by the same people.

Anyway, my bf and I both had the bread pudding. It was really good.  Nice and moist... I hate a dried out bread pudding.  This place is pretty expensive, and they do have a variety of entrees on their menu, but nothing that made me say,"I've gotta have that!"  I wasn't blown away by it.

We may stop in here for lunch some time for sandwiches. Their outside patio looked so inviting, I'll go back for that alone!

I went to this location ONE time to buy supplies for my classroom when I was teaching, and will never go again.  While I was in line waiting to have my items rung up, a man walked up in front of me and put his things on the belt or whatever. I said,"Excuse me, sir... I was next."  He laughed and said,"You slow, you blow..." and continued to pull his things out of his shopping cart.  Rather than stop this man from cutting in line, the male cashier laughed and said,"Right? Oh well!" and finished his transaction.  He continued to laugh after the man was gone and told me to,"smile" because "it's not that serious."   I told him we'll see what his manager thinks and left the store.  

I reported this incident to the management, but who knows whether or not it was addressed.  Just thought I should add my two cents because as I can see, this store has continued to specialize in poor customer service.  Some things never change.
Shrimp and Grits  +  Pumpkin French Toast  =  SCORE!!!   Nap time! lol

I really HATE shopping at Whole Foods. Not for the same reasons as most people.  I don't mind paying extra for organic food. My fiance is a very healthy eater, and I am TRYING harder to be.  We do a lot of our grocery shopping here, so I'm used to the steep prices. My issue is with the people that shop here. They are RUDE. I'm not sure what it is about Whole Foods that brings out the a-hole in people, but people in this store seem to leave their manners at the door.

For one thing, everyone seems to be in a hurry. They all think whatever THEY came in to buy is more important than what YOU came in to buy.  So... there's constantly people reaching over you to get something (usually without saying "excuse Me"), and lots of "near-misses" with shopping carts.  When we are in Whole Foods, we like to read labels for ingredients and the customers here just don't allow for you to shop leisurely. No matter where you go in the store, you are made to feel like you are in someone's way.  

My rating is based solely on my experiences with the customers. Quality-wise, everyone knows Whole Foods always has fresh produce and we buy a lot of our seafood here. I also like the salad bar, selection of vitamins and herbal supplements and cosmetics.  In fact, if I could remove the customers from this store, I would probably give Whole Foods a solid 4 or 5.

Let's be honest. H & M's clothes are cheap in quality! ( I mean... the thinnest, flimsiest material!! LOL !! ) But.... every now and then, I can find something in there. I have friends who swear by this store, but for me it's pretty hit or miss! So... this weekend, I bought FOUR dresses! CUTE! Each one was $20 or under.  My kind of prices!

Now.... I would never be so bold as to purchase SHOES from there!That's going a bit too far!  I might buy a cheap DRESS, but I will never in my LIFE buy a pair of cheap shoes. (You won't catch me slippin' and slidin'!! LOL )

Gotta go! Time to throw on one of my dresses now! LOL...

I hate this theater- everything about it.  It's such a dreary, dirty, theater, and the sound is awful. I had the misfortune of sitting in the balcony for a gospel play there, and the sound was so bad, I felt like I wasn't even AT the show.  Luckily, I got the tickets free since I was working at Power 99. I 
feel sorry for people who actually PAY to sit there.

I have been to this theater countless times, and each time, I was always reluctant to go.  At times, I have actually missed out on shows I really wanted to go to because it was at Tower. (Most recently Eric Benet, and the upcoming Janet Jackson concert.)

This is one of my favorite casual restaurants in New Orleans and certainly my favorite on Bourbon Street.  It's located in the beautiful historic Royal Sonesta Hotel right near the start of Bourbon Street in the French Quarter. 

I always start with the Creole BBQ Shrimp which has an awesome sauce for sopping bread. And I always end with their bread pudding which is served as a slice like cheesecake with bourbon butter sauce.

On today's visit, I tried the crawfish carbonara. I kid you not but this may be the best carbonara I've ever had in my life. Perfect al dente pasta, rich sauce with prominent bacon flavor, and the crawfish were like little flavor angels singing in my mouth.

The show was great - the sound was great. The security and policies were NOT.

We saw Ziggy Marley tonight and I was forced to either throw away or put my prescription medicine in the car because they were in a pill vial where the label was rubbed off from being in my bag. There were literally 2 1/2 pills in there and I freely showed them and told 2 security guards and the medic what it was. They were dismissive and rude about it.  If I were bringing in something illegal, would I just have the vile hanging out in my bag with my wallet and phone?  They made me feel like I was committing a crime for needing to have medication on me and the medic refused to even hold it for the remainder of the show.  People got in with joints and I can only assume a variety of other drugs.  I guess the trick is to hide the perfectly legal substance that you need?  This seems wrong and it really ruined the night to fight me on this on the way in.  

You want metal detectors to find weapons? Excellent. You want to pat me down?  Great.  You want to tell me that I can't bring in my medication?  THAT is not ok. 

Then the entire show (literally until the last encore song) the  "guest services" people were policing the crowd for pot smoke. They were visually hard and aggressive and stood in the crowd with their arms crossed like military soldiers. This is a Ziggy Marley show, filled with the most peaceful fans around.

This whole experience left a really bad taste in my mouth and honestly, I do not want to go back if they are going to treat everyone like criminals.

These guys saved me!!  I was in a huge bind with another contractor for 3 weeks.  These guys swooped in and saved the day 24 hrs after calling them.  They were extremely professional, efficient, and punctual.  These guys are pros - I'd give them 6 stars if I could!
Amazing food!  Ordering is a bit "Soup Nazi" via Seinfeld on super busy days, but well worth it!  Excellent quality ;)

Honestly, it's a love/hate relationship.  Some of the people that work there are extremely nice and knowledgeable, and some of the people that work there are...not. I witnessed someone calling the store asking if they had eye drops for cats. The cashier just said,  "I don't know, maybe... hold on." Then he asked another worker who also didn't know.  I then asked him what the cat needed the eye drops for and he said, "I don't know, I guess an infection?" So I replied, "Well, if that's the case you should tell them to see a vet. You can't treat a cat eye infection over the counter (I'm an ex-vet tech) If it's just dry eye, you can tell them to get artificial tears anywhere." He rolled his eyes at me basically, but here is my point.  People call pet stores (especially ones with live animals) for medical advice.  Unless you train your staff to answer questions properly or ask the right questions to the customer, it could be a life or death issue.  I just want the workers trained for instances like this.  It's like the blind leading the blind and it is certainly not fair to the animal in question.  Please please train your people to deal with these types of situations. I'd do it myself if you'd let me.

It's not all negative - we have never been there in person but we have ordered from grubhub at least 6 times.  Everything is really great - love the burgers, the chicken BLT, the onion rings, etc.  The ONLY issue that we have is about the pickle fried chicken sandwich.  The chicken itself is never fully cooked!  The first time it was perfect.  The second time the chicken was underdone and we had to put it in the oven. The 3rd time, same thing.  I called and spoke to a manager that time and she was very nice and comped our meal.  We ordered again and I wrote a paragraph on GrubHub to say that the chicken was undercooked the last time and to please make sure it is done.  It came perfect.  Ordered again tonight, wrote "well done please" and it came undercooked AGAIN!  You may ask why we keep ordering? We like the food and my husband likes this sandwich the best - but 3 out of 5 times that we have ordered it the chicken has been visibly undercooked.  It's the only issue we have, but it's kind of a biggie.  I hope that they will figure out the fryer and put and end to this problem.  I don't want to stop ordering from them.

The mushroom burger is amazing.  Literally a burger made of mushrooms - no meat. Crab cake was really good as well. Excellent fries. My only gripe is that is seems most things (bites that I have had of friends food) are extra spicy for no reason.  Ketchup - no need to be spicy. Side of roasted broccoli - no need to be spicy.  I think that they should cut down on the spice factor (or give you the option)  Other than that, love it there!

Excellent food!  Excellent tea!! (Tranquility of my favorite - cures anything)
You used to be able to bring dogs in, but now you can't because some crappy person complained.  That was just an added bonus - loved hanging out with the dogs while waiting for my food to be ready!

This is the tough part.  
Do I love the chicken and donuts? Yes.  
Do I love the workers? Yes.  Do I love that I have been coming here since the beginning and the size of the donuts have changed SIGNIFICANTLY in the past 6 months? NO.  
Come on people - we are paying a fortune per delicious donut and although the price is still high, the donuts themselves are about 1/3 of the size that they used to be.  My rating for everything else would be 5 stars if the donuts hadn't experienced shrinkage.  Perhaps we could rectify this?

We just went for the first time since the location changed and it was a pretty terrible experience.  It was a Tuesday afternoon at 3pm and you literally couldn't move around the store with a shopping cart.  There is all this new stuff (salad bar, chinese food, etc) but there is virtually no room for shoppers to maneuver!  Every aisle that we turned down was a traffic jam. Then waiting to check out took forever! There was not enough space for the people in line to wait and still have people pass through that were still shopping! Each line can hold maybe 3-4 people with carts before it hits the end cap. Then no one can walk by.  This wasn't even a Sunday or a holiday!  There is a ton of food in the store, yet not enough room for the shoppers! Plus they got rid of the bulk coffee because "there wasn't a place for it" - come on!

The parking lot is even worse because there are a TON of people trying to exit into 2 small lanes with a light onto Oregon.  I LOVED Shop Rite, but I honestly don't ever want to go back to this location again. The workers are overwhelmed, the shoppers are frustrated and disappointed.... this was not a good change.

**** Edit - they are VERY responsive to critique and after asking a few managers they agreed to bring the bulk coffee back to the store! They even called me to tell me!  That I do sincerely appreciate

Very impressed with the treatment and compassion. Came in with an emergency with a pet sitting client and they were just so wonderful about everything!

They have also seen my chinchillas for some geriatric issues.  :)
To get ready for my friend's wedding, had a hot shave and was really impressed. Old-fashioned details make this the perfect spot for a great shave or haircut.

I really wanted to like this hotel, and there are many things to like about it. Unfortunately, after staying there for a week, I won't go back. For $185 a night, a discount I was told, I booked a room in May 2008 for my friend's wedding in October 2008. The front desk staff are a mixed bag, some very professional, others downright rude. 

Very elegantly redone, and right in the heart of the French Quarter, my small room on the eighth floor, with what they said had a river view, looked out on a parking lot and a dirty side street. Maid service was excellent, but the cable wasn't working and I had to call down to have it fixed. I really liked the Carousel Bar, although the bartender was a bit on the slow side, but no big deal. The room pool and gym, I should say, are quite nice. 

On the fourth night I was there, I had to be moved as my neighbors were drunkenly speaking on their cell phones and then started having sex. The woman started screaming for the man to stop and that it hurt, so before I moved rooms, I called security. 

The room I was moved to on the seventh floor was exactly the same as the first. And, despite my having requested a room with a view since the first day I was there, nobody helped me with this request despite my repeated attempts. 

I called the manager on duty, who told me he would upgrade my room and give me a free breakfast. Unfortunately, this wouldn't do, as I was leaving in a day and explained to him I would have liked to have a view room when I checked in. He said that despite being the manager on duty, he could not adjust my room rate but he would check with his boss to see what they could do. I NEVER heard back from them. 

It's really a shame when you do your best to get a good deal, and the hotel you stay in just doesn't care.

Great setting! Was out early on a Saturday morning walking around the French Quarter taking photos and decided to drop in for breakfast. It's a great little local coffee shop and the breakfast food was good! I got French toast that was very tasty and came with a bowl of fruit. The Americano was excellent! There is also a broad selection of pastries available as well.

I liked Luke but I was not blown away.  I think my friend liked it more than I did.  The food was good but, with one exception, nothing overly special.  The exception was the P&J oysters which were absolutely fantastic.  If I were to go back, I would make this my meal.  Unfortunately, the shrimp and grits were average and not nearly as good as I have had elsewhere.  And the vanilla cake was really nothing more than a basic pound cake.  The atmosphere is a really cool, which I did not expect as a restaurant located in the first floor of a major chain hotel.  Unfortunately, given all the great food options in a city like New Orleans, Luke is really quite average and I would have a hard time justifying going back.

One of the prettiest malls from the outside however there aren't many stored there that I frequented when I went to UCSB.  Now State street has had an Extreme Makeover.  Tons of brand names stores right on State like Juicy (but who really shops there now? even though I think there stuff is adorable), surf shops galore and Betsey Johnson.

It isn't always the cheapest (quite the contrary) but I used to have a Chevron card so this was a no brainer.  Not only did I come to this location for gas but for food, Reality Bites style.  No joke.  I remember coming home with bags full of groceries.  Snacks more like it...

I was a regular here and it is the most convenient place to fill gas whether you want to admit it or not.  I always stopped en route to go home to Monterey.
My sister and I played Nationals here for Junior Tennis in '94 or '95.  Of course, with my luck I would lose to a girl from Mexico living in Fresno, I mean Fres-yes.

Yes, I liked this place when it was Anthropologie more... however it is hard to dislike a place that sells adorable clothing for cheap (and it's okay that the quality is cheap because even if you get one or two "wearings" out of your outfit it is worth it).  Once I start making $$$ again I will like this place less but for now, I heart F21 but this one is not as organized as several of the others I have been to.

10 years ago when I was 20, I walked in with another female companion with a group of 6 or 8  guys (I don't remember) .  It was a Bachelor Party and they prettty much dragged us innocent girls in.  I'm pretty sure we weren't served although I don't remember (this is becoming the theme of this evening)...

Next thing I know we made it to her apartment and I had thrown up as I opened the door of her 325 ti... who drives a 325 ti... baby hatchback BMW?!?  (No that is not nice Shiho!)  It was a very cute car and a lovely birthday present she got when she was 16.

I rarely threw up back then so something must have gone done during the night.  I do not recall all the details but thank Sandbar for getting an eventful (unfortunately not very memorable for me) evening started.

Initially I sat down to kill some time while I waited for my friends to arrive from their United flight from LAX.  I didn't have many options so I sat down at Outpost Cafe with my large check-in bag and my ski bag and got a glass of Pinot Grigio.  Why not.  

Now I know the elevation of Boise is nothing extreme in fact it's probably sea level but Google just said they are about 1/2 mile above sea level... maybe that's why the wine hit me so hard?!? Probably because I'd neglected to eat my honey roasted peanuts and pretzels on my Southwest flight, lunch and breakfast.

I ended up ordering the wings because I felt bad for just sitting there... I ordered another glass of wine and this one was a big girl glass and I had a hard time finishing it...almost.  The wings were good but not as good as they were the day after.

Yes, I had 8 leftover so I took them with me to McCall, reheated and served them with fresh celery sticks and their ranch and my friend and I thought we had the best wings ever.  Seriously, they will be my Wingstop moving forward but unfortunately they are in Boise and I live in California.  Not lovely.

I like this Chevron (which was under construction) not for their gas but their mini mart.  They don't offer a lot but this is one of the last stops before Mt. Rose so it was conveneient to pick up some ice for our cooler to keep our beverages cold enough to enjoy post skiing... tailgating style.

Clean new smoke shop in a convenient location (if you are going to school at UCSB and have a car that is) offering all of your smoking supplies.  Cigs, cigars, cigarillos, pipes, tobacco etc...

Kind gentleman owner behind the counter who looks like he'd be happy to help you but usually you know what you want when you are hitting up these type of places.  This shop just opened its doors 3 months ago so hit it up if you are into this kind of stuff.

I don't smoke, nor do I socially smoke (smoke after drinking) because some people think those two are different but I heard my sister make a comment of pooping and cigarettes and as a person who always had a hard time pinching a loaf, I thought hey why not(question mark).  I'm not promoting smoking but am promoting healthy and regular bowel movements.

Special: Marlboro Menthol Lights 2 packs for $8

Solid not going to complain, I mean they are doing it... bringing pho to mainstream America (well UCSB that is).  I wish they were here when I attended UCSB but better late than never.  

I had the Pho Tai and if you are craving pho then this may satisfy your craving.  However, I prefer my thin slices of meat rare and thin.  My noodles were a bit limp and I like my bean sprouts crisper.  I also would have loved me some more jalapeno, limes and Thai Basil.  Can't get enough of the Thai Basil.

My sister got her usual bowl and WOW that was amazing.  I would definately reccommend that.  Ban Cha Gio Tom Thit Nuong a lovely medley of Rice noodles, egg roll, grilled shrimp choice of pork or chicken served atop of lettuce, cucumbers, bean sprouts, cilantro, crushed peanuts and served with a ddipping sauce (containing fish sauce I'm guessing).  Solid.  It's also called the #32 in case you are wondering.  This bowl is bursting with flavors.  My sister got the pork and it was tender and full of flavor.  Addiciting.

The 2 young men behind the counter were very sweet and lovely.  Although I'm more of a salty girl but when it comes to Vietnamese Coffee, I go all out.  Give me the 2 inches of condensed milk.   They go light here, maybe just looking out for you.
