The cafe is rather small and next to the Blake Hotel.  There was a blues festival going on down the street and we were able to quickly grab a table.

Aside from not being able to make a reservation, this place is fantastic!  

I joined about 10 friends here in celebration of a birthday, and I was so impressed with the efficient, friendly service as well as the tasty, creative bites.

I grabbed a drink at the bar while we waited for our table.  The bartender did a great job of getting to everyone in order.  My drink order was simple, but I appreciated the heavy pour of whiskey in my Jack and diet.  

We were seated at a huge square table near the patio.  Unfortunately it was crazy hot, but I realize they can't control the weather.  We ordered an assortment of appetizers to share:  a few orders of fries, Philly steak egg rolls (sambal ketchup=awesome), guacamole and the best one of all--fried chicken skins dusted with Sriracha powder and smoked honey...smokey, crispy bits of heaven!  I tried the "meat pie" which included a green curry chicken with peas in a flaky crust.  I loved it.  Everyone seemed happy with their choices.  For dessert we shared a tasty do-it-yourself smore set up complete with a little fire!

This was a winning choice for the celebration!

I absolutely love the cut and color/highlight Ashley gave me last Thursday.  I came in with a very specific idea and she almost completely nailed it.  While I adore the dark brown with hints of mahogany, I was hoping for more of a violet hue (which we discussed).  That said, she probably did me a favor by keeping it minimal.  I have received tons of compliments (and a big thumbs up from my boyfriend, which is always nice) and will certainly recommend Ashley to anyone.  She was great.

I'm so conflicted...because while I absolutely love a few of the menu items (Wasabi Ahi Caesar!), this is never my first choice.  Honestly, I don't know that I've ever said, "Hey!  Let's go to Jackson's!"; especially after they got rid of the Chorizo Corn Dogs and Carolina Rangoon.  Sigh.

The layout is a little funky.  Unless you are seated, it is near impossible to not feel in the way.  I absolutely hate that feeling.

That said, the service is usually decent and the bartenders are excellent at their job.

I've purchased my '09 Beetle Convertible from their sister store in Cool Springs and have had all of my service (including the service on my old Jetta) done at that location...until I desperately needed headlights (hey, they are under warranty...worth the hassle) and to have a weird window issue fixed.  Just for the headlights alone, there was a one week + wait to get into Cool Springs, so I made an appointment here.  Next day.  Awesome.

While the waiting area isn't as swank as the Cool Springs location; it is clean, comfortable and has good free coffee.  The service manager and the employees were fantastic at keeping me up to speed with what was taking a while (the window) and gave me realistic estimates on when Captain Jack (car's name) would be ready.  The checkout was quick and the girl (hate that I forgot her name) was super nice.  

In comparison to my experiences at the Cool Springs store with both my current car and old car...I do believe I have found a new place for warranty-covered services.

I have to be honest. The reason for a four star as opposed to five is the ridiculous crowd on Two-for-Tuesdays. Can't help it, I'm getting up there in age and my tolerance for a bar packed with undergrads has diminished. It's the "Get off my lawn!" thing and I suffer from it. There, I admitted it. 

Okay, back to the shiny happy stuff! Sam's is a kick ass sports bar. Not only do they have a great selection of tap/beer bottles, the bartenders are very skilled with the cocktails (even delicious coffee based hot drinks in the winter). Even better than the booze is the food. CHICKEN TENDERS. I'm not kidding, these are the best in town. Perfectly crunchy, beer-battered pieces of heaven! I love getting the traditional wing sauce along w/ ranch or bleu cheese for dipping. You can get them tossed in the wing sauce, but that tends to kill the crunch. Another star are the wings. Even if you think "Extra Hot" might be too much, just try it. I'm usually a strict medium - weak hot when it comes to spicy foods, but they smelled so good I had to steal one from my boyfriends plate. They aren't on the menu, but they will gladly add some extra heat to the usual hot for you. Other standouts include the rib appetizer, beer battered onion rings, cheeseburger and (when they have it) the creamy chicken artichoke soup. 

So yeah, absolutely a terrible place for a dieter, though I have been known to bargain...oh, I'll have the chicken tenders but with celery instead of fries, etc. Yeah, not really a great solution but it is worth the extra time in the gym. 

So yeah 2 stars food, 1 star drinks, 1 star service and 0 stars because I'm an old mean bat. 

Oh, and one additional note regarding Tuesdays...while two-for-one is every Tuesday, somethings the pack is at Sportsman's instead. Our theory is that they send a mass memo/text/sky-writer out to let everyone know. One or the other is ALWAYS packed to capacity on Tuesday.

Green curry heaven!  This is by far my favorite spot in Nashville for Thai.

Anytime the craving hits, we head over to this South Nashville gem.  I am so in love with the green curry w/ beef (hot) that I can't speak too much to the other entrees.  I tried a bite of my boyfriend's red curry (native) which was very good, but a little too hot for my taste.  I always have to get the fried bananas for dessert, even if I am stuffed...

Another note is they have a very inexpensive, though limited, wine list.  You can get a decent bottle for less than $20.

Ellie Valentine is ahhhh-mazing! She took my drug store box black hair and turned it to a beautiful blonde in just a few visits. She's also so sweet and easy to talk to. I can't imagine trusting my hair to anyone else!

I have to admit...I did not think I'd love Edley's as much as I do.

I was prepared to be frustrated by the ordering process and have a hard time finding a seat.  That couldn't have been further from reality.  

We arrived at 8:30 tonight (Saturday).  There were multiple tables available as well as a cozy booth that we quickly claimed.  The line to order was short (and I appreciated its location in the back that provided adequate space for a line (see Local Taco).  I ordered the chicken platter and boyfriend ordered the pulled pork sandwich (we both chose mac & cheese and baked beans as sides).  The food came out lightning quick!  I was initially put off by my chicken being on the bone smothered in cole slaw and sauce.  I generally prefer pulled chicken in barbecue form.  It was very awkward to cut in the plastic basket, but once I broke through, it was super juicy and delicious!  Boyfriend had nothing but praise for the pulled pork sandwich.  Beans were a-okay and the mac and cheese was freaking awesome.  I'm a huge fan of baked style (save the creamy goop for the blue box!).  The hot sauce had a great kick and was a nice accent to the white sauce.  The cornbread was nice and flavorful.

Here are my tiny critiques...
-They could have better signage for adult beverages.  Based on the menu and the ordering station, it appears that tea and sodas are the only drink options (that is not the case).  
-Put the sauces in bottles!  It was a bit frustrating to have to return to the order station to get little plastic cups of sauce.  I'm not planning on drinking it, but they were a little stingy with the good stuff.
-Make it clear on the menu that the chicken platter is a half chicken...and serve it on a real plate or at least with a sharp cutting utensil.  Those plastic knifes don't cut through the skin.

Those are petty complaints, I realize.  The food is tasty, service is great and the price is definitely right.  I will be back!

Great little spot to pick up some comfort food in a hurry.  I tried the mushroom stroganoff with no mushrooms (I know, I know) and braised beef.  The beef was excellent and the sherry cream sauce was perfectly seasoned.  The price for the bowl and a drink was right around $9.  I called a few minutes ahead and it was ready when I arrived.  I also like the second register for call ahead orders.  Well done.

I was so excited when I saw Zyka pop up on Grub Hub.  Free delivery and a minimum of only $10?  Fantastic!  

Unfortunately, the food is just meh.  I ordered my favorite, Mattar Paneer.  There is not a single pea anywhere in the dish.  I don't know if I received the wrong order or what, it was a big let down.  Also, the sauce is very bland.  Not spicy, whatsoever.  The Naan and Raita were decent.  The Gulab Jamun had an odd taste to it.  

I'll likely give them another try.  Hopefully this was a fluke.

Delicious greasy burgers!  While this one stuck with me the rest of the night, I enjoyed one heck of a tasty burger in this Flat Rock area dive this past Saturday.

We arrived around 7pm to a mostly full bar.  Tons of open tables that had a cell phone or a jacket, but no patrons.  Odd.  We eventually found a spot to settle and proceeded to enjoy delicious burgers, fries, onion rings and an unfortunately warm draft beer.  No worries, I still inhaled it.  Prices were fantastic!  Burgers start at $4, and my draft PBR was $2.  

I'm looking forward to my next visit!  Hopefully during the 'infamous' Friday night karaoke!

Cafe Beignet is like a hot chick with no substance. There's a reason you want to hit on her, stick around for some time, and would call her in the future. But her personality is the reason you may lose her phone number.

When it comes to Cafe Beignet, the live jazz music was the reason I went in, stayed a while, and would come back. But their food is the reason the latter may not happen.

Their typical touristy Cajun food was decent, but it lacked flair, culture, and was far from memorable. In a city like New Orleans, there are so much better options. Unknowing tourists must come here for the awesome vibe which features patio dining and amazing live jazz music in the middle of a classic courtyard.

I loved eating on the courtyard taking the energy of New Orleans in. The entire experience transported me into another world. Unfortunately, the food brought me back to reality.

My recommendation is that you eat somewhere else. Just come here for some dessert, coffee, or a beer. 

In the end, Cafe Beignet truly is like the hot with no substance. That makes it mistress material.

In New Orleans, the legendary Bourbon Street is full of sin. And by sin, I mean vomit, discarded thongs, booze, beads, and boobs.

If you need an escape from the debauchery on Bourbon Street, you should consider stepping into LeBooze. Most of the clientele here is fully clothed, chatting in their deep voices, sipping on scotch, smoking cigars, and showing off a little chest hair. And these are just the women that I am talking about. Kidding.

Kidding aside, the place has a classy feel with dark brown wood furnishings, some big screens, and a very professional and polite staff. My bartender looked like Jon Bon Jovi. Yes, that Jon Bon Jovi. The guy that your wife thinks about whenever she needs to get herself in the mood. You know, in the mood to clean the kitchen.

Anyway, after every round I would buy for my clients, I would say things like...

"Oh! Oh! Drinkin' on a prayer!"

"Your drink is like bad medicine. Bad medicine is what I need!"

"It's my life! It's now or never!"

The bartender was not pleased, but he was a good sport about it. He fueled up my clients, so I could take him to other less than desirable joints on Bourbon Street. 

I heart NOLA.

Food just tastes better in New Orleans. And the food at Popeye's is no exception.

My fries were were crispy, seasoned, and delicious as they should be. And my chicken strips were hot, thick, and juicy. Pretty much just like my...

*Remainder of review censored by the Internet*

I agree with several other of the reviews that the cannolis are the single best thing here the canolis are great and the cheesecakes are excellent however the price of $4 for single cannoli seems very high to me and higher than New York City. Other than price this is a worthwhile stop.

Always had an affinity for this train station.

Maybe because I spent 10 yrs in Philly and walk by here many times on my way to university.

Maybe it's from the indelible movie images in "Witness" and "Blow out".

The WW1 statue of an angel carrying a soldier to heaven is really quite striking and the ceiling and lighting, coupled with the ample benches for seating, just make it a good spot to wait for your train.

It seems like food court has some vacancy problems and I notice a longstanding bar that was a nice waiting spot too, is now gone.

Regardless, it is VERY convenient whether coming or going and is nice to admire.

Im going to admit that it has been months since my trip to Philly but I can still remember every moment of our dinner at Amada. Everything from the atmosphere, to the staff and most important the food was exquisite. 
We had many many different items and remember loving them all. The sangria was nothing special but they had a great wine list. I would definately come here again when I am back in Philly. 
P.S. the prices are not too high and its a great spot for a date night ;)

This particular Anthropologie location is just stunning. Everything is designed so well and the layout within a historic home that used to be owned by Mr. Drexel himself is just great. 
I bought two teapots that I didnt want to carry all the way home so they kindly shipped it for free! Ah-mazing.

Sort of a must visit place, you know?  It is a beautiful historic thing that re-creates a moment in time that is long gone.  What's more, they don't "create" it... it's obviously re-created, but that's fine.  It's one of the few places that ends up, by default, a nice, normal bar with jazz.  It isn't too gimmicky - and if you can sort of stop wandering about slack jawed, you can go here and have a brilliant time watching ragtime jazz.  Just sit and relax.  Patty O's, The Dungeon, and all the other gimmicky bars can wait.  This is a gimmick I am hip on.

Definitely recommend this place for a weekend jazz brunch. There are two dining rooms, and the jazz musicians move from room to room, so you'll definitely get some action during your meal. This place is always crowded, so I recommend reservations! 

Food was phenomenal. Best shrimp and grits. The fried green tomato's was better than the one we had at Mr. B's Bistro. 

This place is known for the turtle soup. I would say get it (to share). It's worth a try. The soup is definitely robust, and you can't have too much of it.

So yes this place is known for donuts, but you yelpers, the sliders!!! The sliders are sooo good! I actually think the sliders are better than the donuts! I think we got the original slider, and it was delicious. Coffee is good too. It's a very hipstery place, but what do you expect, it's off of Magazine, right?

Very cozy and quaint- Excellent location

We stayed here for 3 nights- right in the heart of post- mardi-gras season.  Staff is very helpful. Room was clean and reasonably quiet (first floor, facing pool).  The bed was very comfortable and the room well appointed.

My only complaint was that the wired internet service did not work the entire time we were there. Even had the hotel mgr test it out. (My husband relies on this for his secure network laptop.) Fortunately the wireless works just fine.

How rare is it to have a sushi restaurant that has very attentive wait staff, creative menu and lovely traditional choices as well. I'm just glad that this rare gem is within walking distance from me.

Okay, okay I'll give it another try already!  
(Note to self: ALWAYS check Yelp BEFORE your first visit to a restaurant which serves food that is totally unfamiliar to you.)
We must have ordered the wrong stuff. 
I would not normally eat anything named "______ paste" and am not sure why I did today. Shrimp paste. Never again. It's just not for me.
I had a dish with white rice, a fried egg, and 4 pork based items. The shredded pork was served cold but would have been better warm. The pork chop was ok, but the other 2 items are still a mystery to me. I'm pretty sure their ingredients included entrails of some sort. Again, just not my thing. She had a skimpy sandwich. Blah.
Lemonade was good. French coffee with milk over ice was good.
The service was consistently bad during the entire visit. We were one of only 2 tables when we arrived and there were maybe 8 tables active when we left. I only ever saw 1 wait-person. She was surly, but had the food been tasty it wouldn't have been that big a deal. CASH ONLY.

The beer and the food here are consistenly good.
Wings are fantastic as is the hummus. The Chicken Parm Sandwich is delicious and the Fish and Chips look amazing. I'm not a huge fan of the pizza. Wish the crust was better. The bartenders, Charday, Heather and Jacqueline are a lot of fun and the staff is solid. There are many long-time employees which speaks well as far as I'm concerned. 
50 cent wings and $3 craft pints on Sundays. Can't go wrong.

Just got back from our first trip to this fantastic place.  You don't need to go here for the decor (lacking), ambiance (barren) location (less than ideal), or even for the service (great). You need to go here for the food. 
Traditional and authentic Cuban fare made from scratch and to order.
We had Tomales Cubanos and Mariquitos con Mojo as appetizers simply because of a Yelp review. They were both as advertised...delicious. The Mariquitos are long strips of flash fried plantains. They are great by themselves or with the fabulous olive oil/garlic sauce. 
Neither of us were big Tamales fans...until tonight. Just excellent. Not too wet or too dry. The consistency is reminiscent of a really good cornbread dressing. Great flavor. We ate all of it.
She had the Original Cubano sandwich. Very traditional and tasty and large.. 
I got the Masitas de Cerdo Fritas. Chunks of some of the most tender and flavorful pork I have ever had the good fortune to consume. The Tostones (fried flattened plantain slices) and Congris Cubano (rice and black beans cooked together) that came as sides were perfect for the dish. Since we ate every morsel of both appetizers we each brought half of our dinners home.
The total including tax for two apps, two entrees, two beers and a Cafe con leche was $33. Tremendous value.
We will be back often and I'd be willing to bet you'll return regularly if you give this true gem a try.

A perfectly acceptable place for a meal. It's not mind-blowing by any means, but sometimes you just want a decent, sit-down dinner.
I ordered the Soup and Salad and a Sushi Roll.
The Clam Chowder was very good. VERY thick. Well seasoned. Not real heavy on clams. Filling.
The salad was sub-par. Small and had a TON of that fake shredded cheese type product you find on Shoney's salad bars the world over. (Digressing, I took a tour of a plant in Humbolt, TN where this orange-ish concoction is made. Let's just say it's NOT cheese.)
The Sushi was fine. It was a shrimp something-or-other with wasabi mayo.
Sweet tea was good.
Lisa provided us with great service and was the highlight of the evening.

Most Mexican restaurants around here are cut from the same cloth. It's not a bad cloth, in fact, I would give 90% of the one's I've been to a 3 star A-OK rating. This La Terraza is a step above for me for a few reasons:
1. They bring little bowls that everyone can spoon their own salsa into, eliminating the distress of double dipping. I like that.
2. Their Chorizo Tacos Autenticos' rock and are $2 each.  Very simple: Chorizo, onion and cilantro with lime and avocado slices if you're into that sort of thing. They cook the Chorizo until it has a slight crunchiness. So freaking good.
3. The staff is fantastic. Haven't had a dud yet. 
4. You can order a chicken chimichanga ala carte for $4. It comes covered in queso, so if you're gonna get one don't pay extra for queso with your chips. There's plenty.
5. They just got these new chairs that are boss.

A solid option for Ameri-Mex dining.
It's hard to write a Useful/Funny/Cool review when everything was just fine, good, average, satisfying and as expected.
The pulled pork burrito with the green sauce was noteworthy.
They need new booths. They're saggy.

Very cute little coffee shop in a quiet part of Philly. It was a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of the touristy area and south street.

The coffee was good and hot and the bagel was ehhh....but im a new yorker..it takes a lot to impress me bagelwise.

They have lil tiny vegan donuts that are tasty too. 

Warning: This place attracts hipsters galore.

such tiny little reviews for such a big and wonderful place! cmon people!

This store is owned and operated by Julia Zagar, the wife of Isaiah Zagar, the amazing mosaic artists who's work you can see all over the city.

The store is 3 floors big and she utilizes every square inch of space. There's stuff EVERYWHERE.  I am a huge fan of mexican folk art and collect dia de los muertos pieces so this place was right up my alley. 

The prices arent outrageous either. There are plenty of items for people shopping in all price ranges. Thats a lot to be said since most of the stuff is one of a kind pieces.

No matter who you are or what youre into, if youre on south street you need to stop in. You will find something you love.

Support small business!

Good place to see a hardcore show. Everything always runs smoothly and on time. I love that. Theres an upstairs to get away from all the sweaty dudes and theres a bar up there and seating. 

The roads around here are all weird and torn up so be careful. Theres always plenty of parking.

LOVE LOVE LOVE MARK!

WANNA ROLL HIM UP AND SUGAR AND CINNAMON AND EAT HIM!

no wait....thats what he said about a previous customer. But the same goes for him!

This antique store is tiny but has lots of great items on the CHEAP!
 My boyfriend and I bought 2 retro little suitcase....2 for $20! WITH KEYS!
cmon now thats just silly.

He writes your name down on the receipt and repeats it (great memorization technique). He wants to remember you and I find that to be quite a rarity now'a'days.


If youre in the area (located across the street from eastern state penn) go inside and take a look. Tell Mark that Jenn and Hugo from NY sent ya!

"Well, most recently, there's room 309, there's this scary Mexican gangster dude poking his finger in my chest. There's his hooligan kids snapping their fingers at me. There's a putrid, rotting corpse of a dead whore stuck in the springs of the bed. There's rooms blazing afire. There's a big fat needle from God knows where, stuck in my leg, infecting me with God knows what. And finally there's me, walking out the door, right fucking now. Buenas noches. "

- Four Rooms

This is how my experience was.  2 stars because getting a hotel IN Philadelphia for $150+ seemed silly when this place was so close and only 1/3 of that.

I can't believe I never reviewed this...

I love "It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia" so naturally, I HAD to come here.  AWESOME "Mac & cheese" but didn't like the "It's Always Sunny" beer.  Still a great place to hang out with friends though.  Now, crossing my fingers in hopes to see Rob" McElhenney  and Kaitlin Olson...

I didn't know what to expect with Cotardo's... as we pulled up, we came up to a strip mall with blackened windows. Surprisingly, the decor inside was like being in an old school Italian restaurant. They don't take reservations, but we didn't have to wait long.

My wife and I went with another couple and we enjoyed our evening. The garlic bread was good and the service was good... it was consistent... that's always good!!!

As far as the food goes... none of us knew that each entree came with soup and salad. The soup was a tomato pasta soup... hearty and nice subtle flavors. The salad was just chopped lettuce, but again we didn't know we were going to even get it so it was a plus.

For my main meal, I got the lobster and black  ravioli. My wife ordered the chicken parm and lasagna combo. The flavors were good enough, but our feed didn't seem hot enough. It was warm, but not really hot. It was if it had been sitting out for a bit of time.

Regardless, we were just about full by the time that entrees came so they became leftovers.

The overall experience was nice. Good food, good service, nice decor... a pleasant low key evening out!!!

I'm going to keep this short and simple...

Pros: Wonderful food, incredibly low prices, great portion size and friendly service.

Cons: A bit out of the way... 

I went here with my wife because I bought a gift certificate from Living Social. Totally worth the trip. We had the Queso Fundido... so good!!!! I want to go back tomorrow!!!!

Pretty authentic tastes and friendly service. Can't beat that!!!

So my wife and I decided to drop in after I saw a bunch of people on Facebook raving about this place. They were saying stuff like it's the best restaurant in the CH Mall and that it was "an amazing restaurant"... People went on to day that it was one of their favorite restaurants.

The décor was nice... didn't look overly high end, but it was nice for a store in the mall.

The menu is small... a few salads, sandwiches, entress and kids meals.

My wife got a roasted vegetable paninni and I got a pizza with prosciutto, herbs and different cheeses. After a few bites my wife said, "wow... I really like this sandwich. I REALLY like it". I enjoyed my pizza too... reminded me of a fantastic place in San Francisco that we were at a few years ago.

The ingredients tasted fresh and the food tasted good. What more could you want?!??! Would I call it one of my favorite restaurants? Heeeeeeeell no... but was it a step above normal mall food? Yes... very much so.

My wife and I both agreed that our server, Chelsea, was pretty awesome. She saw that we had a baby with us... not only did she say how cute our son was(always a plus), but she also said that she would take our order instead of us having to go to the food counter to order the food. It wasn't the biggest deal in the world, but she took the extra time to make sure that a couple with a small baby were taken care of... She checked up on us multiple times, brought over our check at the right time and made sure our sodas were always full... and she did all of these things with a smile.

My wife and I have gone to fine dining restaurants in Philly and NYC where we spent 4 or 5 times as much on food that wasn't as good and have gotten less than stellar service. It was a great treat to eat here... would I come back? Yes... for sure!!!

I came here with some co-workers for lunch... service was top notch, but the food was kind of a let down. Don't get me wrong... it was ok, but nothing overly exciting that I couldn't get cheaper at already established local places.

I only tried this place out because my office is within walking distance. Before I went, I checked out Yelp. I saw so many negative reviews, but I was really jonsin for some Chinese food.

I took a chance... I figured that a lunch order of General Tso's Chicken with fried rice and wonton soup for $6.00 sounded super cheap. But I could just throw it out if I didn't like it. 

Long story short... I completely devoured the meal. I enjoyed it so much that I went back the next day and got the same order and enjoyed it just as much.

Is it fancy? Nope... I've been eating Chinese food all my life. This place isn't bad. For the price, it's a steal.

Best part... no MSG!!!!

I can't speak on all of the items on the menu, but I really enjoyed this.

I come here at times since it's so close to work... today, I stopped in to get some lunch. As I was waiting in line to pay, I noticed that an elderly woman was at the cashier. she was clearly having issues understanding how much to pay or what items were on sale. The cashier, let's just call her D, was so rude. She was rolling her eyes and sighing every time the elderly woman asked a question.

When "D" handed the elderly woman her change, not only did she not look at her, she intentionally placed her hand in a location that the elderly woman would need to stretch to retrieve it. WTF?!?!?!?!

But the worst thing about the whole scenario is that "D" and the next customers in line were making fun of the elderly woman as she left. How horrible is that?

I've been here hundreds of times and I've never seen anything like it. So maybe this is just an isolated incident... maybe they need to have some customer service training.

But what I saw from "D" was just disgusting.

Sad sad sad!!!! I love this place... really I do... my wife and I have been there a few times. We even got to meet Jose Garces there once.

But we went there for lunch a few weeks back. From the moment we walked through the door, I got a bad feeling and it only went down from there.

When we walked through the door, we were asked if we wanted to sit at the high tables at the bar. I hate when restaurants ask you to do that. It's almost as if they are saying, "we don't want to waste our tables on you so we'll sit you at the bar".  There were literally two other tables with people in them at that time. I'll let that one go though... maybe this is some sort of acceptable business practice for restaurants.

But the problems really started with our waitress... not only did we wait almost 10 minutes for her to say hello to us. And when she did, there was no smile, she just said, "I'll be back to bring you both tap water..." errr... what if we wanted bottle water?!?!! 

At no point during the time we ordered our food, to the end of the meal did she smile at us. It was the absolute worst service I have ever had at a JG restaurant. and I've been to most of them many times. I forget her name, but she had reddish/brown hair. She was so condescending and dismissive... it got to the point where we didn't even want to talk to her. 

The only time she smiled was when she brought the bill over... I guess she was hoping for a better tip. (sigh)

What made it worse was that she was so warm and inviting to the other tables that were seated after us. My wife and I sat there in shock. The only saving grace with the wait staff was that one of the runners was probably one of the best I've had at a JG restaurant. She went above and beyond to make sure we were happy.

Luckily the food was fantastic(as always). 

If this were my first time at this restaurant, I would NEVER go back.

That being said, my wife and I are going to Rosa Blanca this weekend... I'm hoping for a nicer experience.

My wife and I went today during dinner time. We previously visited the location in Philly and have been to The Mesa Grill in the Bahamas. We arrived right before the huge dinner rush and got a seat right at the bar.

A few surprises for the night... 

#1... They didn't have the bourbon infused vanilla milkshake. After speaking to Mr. Flay's business partner, he told us that they couldn't get a liquor license. Oh well, the following makes up for it.

#2... My wife and I accidentally ran into Mr Flay's business manager this weekend. He was there tonight and remembered us and we spoke to him for a good bit. We told him that Mr Flay should look into opening up a shop in Collingswood since it's such a great food town. But that's a discussion for another time.

#3... While we were sitting at the bar, I noticed Bobby Flay at the kitchen window. We were lucky enough to meet him and take a pic with him. I felt somewhat bad that we were interrupting him while he was working, but other people were doing it so.....

OK... the food... just a great burger and great fries. I got the Santa Fe Burger and my wife got the Dallas Burger. We also had some sweet potato fries... great meal. Of course, Bobby Flay was quality control so it's going to be good.

The burger's are reasonably priced and taste great. What more could you want? (bourbon in the vanilla milkshake of course!!!!). BTW, the staff was friendly too!!!

Check it out... worth the wait and price!!!

I'll get down to it quickly... I haven't been here since I was a Junior in high school over 17 years ago.. and today i saw why. I went there with my wife and parent's for breakfast. 

to start off, my dad's coffee mug had lipstick on it... nasty.

then, the waitress was horrible... not friendly at all. i can't even express how cold she was. we would ask for coffee, she would say that she would get it, but never came back for it. she never checked on us after the food was delivered. horrible...

i wouldn't ever recommend this place... the food was meh at best.

I'd rather spend my cash at the Silver Diner right down the road

So this is going to be a quick review... I went there this weekend for the first time. The other only Garcas place I've been to is Distrito(I loved that place btw). As far as the décor goes, I love it. I loved that it wasn't too loud, but wasn't entirely reserved as well. The food was great!!! It came out fairly quick and tasted wonderful. Our server was great... she had the right answers for all of our questions and made sure we were attended to.

When we went to Distrito, we were completely "wowed"... we weren't blown away by Amada, but the food was great... not top 5 meals of my life, but great nonetheless. 

Highly recommended!!!
Since my last review I have to say this is easily my favorite place for simple delicious vegan Mexican food. I'm never disappointed. The best part is I have never had to wait for a table.

The store looks super cute and has unique cards which is why I decided to check it out two separate times to look for unique wedding cards. Both times I was completely ignored by the man behind the counter. Both times I was the only one in the store. One time he was watching tv and another he was just staring at his phone. The killer is the second time he actually looked up at me and just looked back at his phone! I couldn't believe it. I did need help but I decided to leave instead because I didn't want to bother him.

Very often you get a pierogi that makes you want to cry! Chewy or just not all that! Mom Mom's will have you crying tears of joy. They are just so good!! All you have to do is try them and you will be able to taste the TLC that is put into each one. They are like delicious clouds of happiness. Also the apple sauce is da bomb. Really it is.
They now have vegan pierogi and stuffed cabbage! Also, since my last review they opened a restaurant in Bridesburg that is super cute and are opening on south street. So exciting!

I've only been here once, and can't wait to go back! The server was very friendly. The sangria was prepared just to our taste. The mole seitan was delicious. The vegan sour cream was a little ucky but..the fooze ball table made up for it. Will definitely be back.

This place is the image that pops into your head when someone says dive bar. Small and smokey with cold beer, dart boards, and karaoke. What else do you expect? It's an awesome place if you want to get your karaoke on but don't want to head into down town. Huge book of music to choose from. Good times are always abound when you head in here. This place is definitely better on the inside.

Awesome little beach-style bar, but on the lake instead. You can come right up on your boat, tie up, then kick back with some drinks and food. Great place to drop into after a day on the lake. Cheese styx were the best I've ever had, def must have. Pastrami bomb was the bomb. Nice breeze came through to top off a great day with friends.

Has the feel of a nice sports bar. Swung by for the first time real quick before heading to zanies. Had the Mason burger, with an egg on top, and the crab corn dogs. I was a little disappointed...disappointed I've never been before! Never had too much luck with restaurants in hotels, except in vegas, but this one is pretty good. Glad I came here instead of eating at the show. It was all cooked perfectly. Staff was friendly and attentive. Food came out super fast. It was a little expensive but well worth it. I expect to be returning in the near future to try more dishes.

This is such an amazing venue! It was beautiful, the acoustics were incredible, and no matter where you sat you had an awesome view! I'm very disappointed in myself for never having been before! This first trip was to see the Video Games Live concert. It. Blew. My. Mind! If they bring this back yearly, I think it could bring more interest from younger generations that don't have exposure to classical style orchestral music. It's safe to say that I will be attending more shows here in the future! 

The only problem is that I saw on the local news that the Schermerhorn is going into bankruptcy! Say it ain't so! Days after finding this gem I hear this terrible news! If the hall survives this I will certainly be buying season passes. The arts deserve our support, and make no mistake this is at at it's finest.

On the night I went they had free parking at LP field with a $3 shuttle to take you to and from the center. I don't know if that is for every show, but if it is, that's a great parking deal!

Also, for those that didn't know, free concerts in the park for the community are held during the summer. Check it out!

On a Tuesday night, this place is pretty much empty.  

I loved the ambiance and the decor.  It's kind of what I want my future kitchen to look like.  Subway tile.  Exposed brick wall.  Old school Edison light bulbs.  Kind of industrial, but warm.  I love it.

Good selection of drinks.  I'm always a fan of milk stouts, so the Milk Man was a plus for me.

The food was decent - I had the tri tip salad.  Portions were quite large, I don't think I finished it.

The service was good.

Overall, we had a positive experience.

I'm a little surprised for the poor reviews here!  Of course if you are comparing this hotel to an Omni or Hyatt, it's definitely nothing to call home about, but for a 3-star hotel comparable to a La Quinta or Best Western, it's really not bad!

The lobby smelled and looked like they just recently underwent a remodel.  My flight landed at 1am, and I was still able to check-in without any issues.

My room was quite pleasant.  I liked the floor to ceiling windows.  Again, it smelled like fresh paint, the bed was comfy, and the bathroom was clean and looked new.   I wasn't crazy about the lighting (LED lights make bedrooms feel cold!), and it took a while for the hot water to come on for my shower.  Other than that, I had a pretty pleasant stay.   

The front desk staff were friendly.  It's in a convenient location with an easy walking distance to the French Quarter and CBD.  Overall, if you're just looking for a no-fuss hotel, the Blake Hotel ain't bad at all!

If you're looking for a nice break from all the heavy Southern food in NOLA, Two Chicks Cafe is your place to rejuvenate with fresh juices, smoothies, and delicious breakfast food items that are perfectly portioned.  Our trip to New Orleans was a food-centric ordeal, so we wanted to start the morning off light.  The Chia Pudding totally called to this Southern California girl's heart.  It wasn't too sweet, and the fresh blueberries gave the pudding a nice balance.  They can get a bit overboard with the walnuts, but I still really enjoyed it.

The Belt Eggwich was also perfect.  Good portion size.  Not too heavy and greasy.  Goes very well with Louisiana hot sauce!

Lastly, I would also recommend the Blue Chick Smoothie if you're one to love acai and smoothie bowls.  On a hot and humid day, this smoothie totally hits the spot.

If you're staying near the Convention Center, Two Chicks Cafe is super convenient.  The line can get pretty long, but it moved quickly.  The service was friendly and quick too.  Overall, I would definitely come back here for a quick and casual breakfast/lunch.

First and foremost, I want to say the service here was excellent.  With a group of 9 girls who may have had 1 drink too many, I know taking care of us was not the easiest task.  On top of that, we also had a show to catch.   Our server(s) were on top of it!  Quick, friendly, attentive, and overall we just had a very positive experience.

Coupled with excellent service, the food was also delicious.  We ordered:

Stuffed P&J Oysters (broiled) 
Raw Oysters
Hot Buttered Crawfish 
Crispy Brussels Sprouts
Fresh Gulf Puppy Drum (white fish)
Shrimp & Grits
Shrimp & Crawfish Etouffee with pasta

I think my favorite item might have been the etouffee with pasta.  There was a ton of crawfish and shrimp, and it was bursting with flavor.  Of course, needless to say the Shrimp & Grits are delicious too.  Oh, and so was the Hot Buttered Crawfish (if you can't tell, I LOVE shrimp and crawfish!).  I don't think you can go wrong with any items with shrimp and crawfish.  How many more times can Cecilia say shrimp and crawfish?!

Yes, I would highly recommend enjoying a dining experience at Luke!  Stellar service, delicious food, beautiful and classy space, it's a win all around!

(Review for the donuts only)

Donuts always have a special place in my heart.  It was Memorial Day weekend, and it was FREAKIN hot and humid.  We were on a self guided tour through the Garden District when we stumbled upon District Donuts.  What a godsend!  1) Air conditioning - YAY!!!!! 2) Donuts - double YAY!!!!!!! I loved the concept of a slider bar AND donuts.  Plus, it was stupid hot outside, so we needed a break too.  

We ordered the Coconut Mango (my favorite), Chocolate Glazed, and Carrot Cake donuts.  They do have some unique and interesting flavors, and from the looks of the other pictures on Yelp, it appears they rotate their flavors pretty often too.  The donuts were light and fluffy, and did I mention they are huge?  Out of the three that we ordered, the Coconut Mango was my favorite.  The cream filling wasn't too sweet, which is perfect for me.  

I do love the space.  Exposed brick walls, kinda industrial looking.  Seating is pretty limited, but since most people are just eating a donut or burgers, the turnover was pretty quick.      

Overall, I think this was a great find!

Bone Daddy and Chicago were excellent and some of the best ribs I've ever had the pleasure of eating. Anywhere you go will be excellent but some are out of this world amazing. 

The people got it right as Chicago BBQ Company won for the Peoples Choice. I personally loved Kinders and its hard to pick one over the other. 

The party starts officially at 11AM but we came on Saturday morning at around 9:45 and there were a dozen places that were already selling. My suggestion is to be on the street and ready to eat before 10AM so you can avoid the HEAT and the crowds. Then by 11 you can go back to your room for a few minutes. 

There is a 97% chance we will be back next year.
